mention.text: Prospects for enactment of the first minimum-wage increase in eight years
the first minimum-wage increase in eight years
Mr. Bush , the Republican presidential candidate
human-resources manager for the U.S. Chamber of Commerce
a minimum-wage bill on the floor , and House members
Sen. Edward Kennedy -LRB- D. , Mass. -RRB- , chairman of the Senate Labor Committee
the legislation 's backers in the House
a spokesman for the House Labor Committee

an attempt by the bill 's opponents to add an amendment , offered by Sen. Orrin Hatch -LRB- R. , Utah -RRB- , ranking minority member of the labor panel , that would allow employers to pay a `` training wage '' to new employees

the bill 's opponents to add an amendment , offered by Sen. Orrin Hatch -LRB- R. , Utah -RRB- , ranking minority member of the labor panel , that would allow employers to pay a `` training wage '' to new employees
an amendment , offered by Sen. Orrin Hatch -LRB- R. , Utah -RRB- , ranking minority member of the labor panel , that would allow employers to pay a `` training wage '' to new employees
a `` training wage '' to new employees
a way for employers to get cheap , entry-level workers
a substitute amendment that would allow each employer to pay 85 % of the minimum wage to as many as 12 full-time students
the limit of six students set by current law
teen-age members of well-to-do families that do n't need larger incomes
